name: tiddler parser
info:
Append tiddler or array of tiddlers in `msg.payload`
to the msg being returned to the requesting wiki.
The node can be used multiple times in a single flow.

## msg.payload
Contains JavaScript object or array of objects containing the fields of the tiddler.
 - **title** field is required 
 - **text** is not required - but is very common

name: read wiki
info: Read tiddlers from a wiki. Normally uses the `msg.wikiname` and `msg.twfilter` fields.

name: \n Sends message response back to TiddlyWiki \n

Returns a few tiddlers in response to the topic 'hello' 
  A 'TW client in' will always be followed by a switch node 
 to select the flow based on msg.topic 
  
 In TiddlyWiki :

'Template' nodes 
 Tiddlers in JSON 
 format above 
 .tid format below
Read the filename \n provided by \n requesting  (sender) tiddler
Move file contents from \n msg.payload to msg.filetext \n to free up msg.payload
Template to create \n tiddler of file contents \n into msg.payload

This TW GUI template (in 'Home' wiki) asks for the 
 file path and file type 
 which are placed in tiddler fields 
 and sent with the request to Node-Red
\n Send contents of a file on the server as a tiddler

Node-Red receives/replies to messages from  
 TiddlyWiki clients via these two nodes 
  
 'TW client out' will only work from messages 
 originating from 'TW client in'
'TW client in' has the sender \n client wiki information in msg.wiki \n needed to respond
'TW client out' sends tiddlers \n in msg.payload back to \n the client
Parses text tiddlers created by \n a Template node into Javascript objects \n Is done automatically in most cases
The flow continues after 'TW client out' \n as can do more processing \n and send more tiddlers later in the flow

This 'hello' flow responds to above TiddlyWiki request 
 with tiddlers in the Node-Red standard 'Template' node
From TW Webserver
func:

return msg;
